title: NVIDIA Announces Upcoming Events for Financial Community
text: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Aug. 19, 2021 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- NVIDIA will present at the following events for the financial community:

title: Nvidia's Improving Outlook Helps Lift Semiconductor ETFs
text: Nvidia Corp. (NasdaqGS: NVDA) rallied Thursday after a majority of analysts upgraded the chipmaker in response to the company's strong quarterly earnings and outlook, lifting semiconductor sector-specific exchange traded funds. On Thursday, the iShares PHLX Semiconductor ETF (NasdaqGS: SOXX) advanced 0.5%, the VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (SMH) increased 0.7%, and the Invesco PHLX Semiconductor ETF (SOXQ) rose [.

title: Nvidia surges 8% after record earnings results blow past analyst expectations
text: Nvidia said it remains hopeful that its proposed $40 billion acquisition of Arm will be approved by regulators soon.

title: Why Nvidia Stock Analysts Are Bullish After Q2 Earnings
text: Nvidia, Inc. (NASDAQ:NVDA) reported stellar quarterly results Wednesday thanks to strong performances by its data center and gaming businesses. The Nvidia Analysts: BofA Securities analyst Vivek Arya reiterated a Buy rating on Nvidia shares and increased the price target from $250 to $260.

title: Why These 2 Nasdaq Crypto Stocks Moved in Opposite Directions Thursday
text: Here's what's behind the disparate movements in share prices.

title: Analysts Are Cautious Post Nvidia's Q2 Results
text: Several analysts raised price targets on NVIDIA Corp (NASDAQ: NVDA) after beating earnings in Q2. Analyst Reactions: Credit Suisse analyst John Pitzer raised the price target on NVIDIA's to $225 from $175, implying an 18.2% upside, and affirmed an Outperform rating.

title: Nvidia's Takeover Bid Delayed By the U.K. What It Means For Other Foreign Deals
text: The U.K. announced this week that another acquisition of a British company—Ultra Electronics—would be investigated on national security grounds.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) Tops Q2 Earnings Estimates on Solid Revenue Growth
text: NVIDIA's (NVDA) second-quarter fiscal 2022 earnings reflect benefits of higher demand for chips used in gaming consoles and datacenters amid the work-and-learn-at-home and gaming wave.

title: Why NVIDIA Shares Are Trading Higher Today
text: NVIDIA Corp (NASDAQ: NVDA) is trading higher Thursday after the company announced better-than-expected second-quarter earnings and multiple analyst firms raised price targets on the stock. NVIDIA reported adjusted quarterly earnings of $1.04 per share, which beat the estimate of $1.02 per share.

title: Nvidia ETFs to Buy on Blockbuster Q2 Earnings
text: Nvidia is expected to see continued momentum in the gaming business into 2H led by new gaming titles, back-to-school, and holiday season.

title: Nvidia Reported Strong Earnings -- but Investors Should Keep Their Eyes on a Few Yellow Flags
text: Supply constraints may hinder the company's growth.

title: The Ratings Game: Nvidia analysts hike price targets as data-center story shines
text: Nvidia Corp. shares traded slightly higher compared with the broader market Thursday as more than half the analysts who cover the chip maker hiked their price targets following the company's strong quarter and outlook based upon data-center gains.

title: Nvidia Stock Pops on Earnings Beat and Better-Than-Expected Guidance
text: Record revenue in the gaming and data center businesses drove growth.

title: Nvidia Warns Its Proposed Acquisition for Arm Will Take Longer Than Expected
text: The deal has faced opposition from rival chip makers and scrutiny from regulators in the U.S., China and Europe.

title: Nvidia's Revenue Is Skyrocketing
text: The tech stock's extraordinary top- and bottom-line momentum continues.
